  manage_courses_admin             -- Courses - manage / update
  manage_developer_keys            -- Developer keys - manage
  manage_feature_flags             -- Feature Options - enable / disable
  manage_master_courses            -- Blueprint Courses - add / edit / associate / delete
  manage_role_overrides            -- Permissions - manage

  manage_user_observers            -- Users - manage observers

  view_course_changes              -- Courses - view change logs

  view_grade_changes               -- Grades - view change logs

  view_quiz_answer_audits          -- Quizzes - view submission log

Some of these permissions are applicable only for roles on the site admin
account, on a root account, or for course-level roles with a particular base role type;
if a specified permission is inapplicable, it will be ignored.

Additional permissions may exist based on installed plugins.

A comprehensive list of all permissions are available:

Course Permissions PDF: http://bit.ly/cnvs-course-permissions

Account Permissions PDF: http://bit.ly/cnvs-acct-permissions

parameters.name: permissions[<X>][locked]
parameters.description:
If the value is 1, permission <X> will be locked downstream (new roles in
subaccounts cannot override the setting). For any other value, permission
<X> is left unlocked. Ignored if permission <X> is already locked
upstream. May occur multiple times with unique values for <X>.

parameters.name: permissions[<X>][applies_to_self]

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: quiz[title]
parameters.description: The quiz title.

parameters.name: quiz[description]
parameters.description: A description of the quiz.

parameters.name: quiz[quiz_type]
parameters.description: The type of quiz.

parameters.name: quiz[assignment_group_id]
parameters.description:
The assignment group id to put the assignment in. Defaults to the top
assignment group in the course. Only valid if the quiz is graded, i.e. if
quiz_type is "assignment" or "graded_survey".

parameters.name: quiz[time_limit]
parameters.description:
Time limit to take this quiz, in minutes. Set to null for no time limit.
Defaults to null.

parameters.name: quiz[shuffle_answers]
parameters.description:
If true, quiz answers for multiple choice questions will be randomized for
each student. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: quiz[hide_results]
parameters.description:
Dictates whether or not quiz results are hidden from students.
If null, students can see their results after any attempt.
If "always", students can never see their results.
If "until_after_last_attempt", students can only see results after their
last attempt. (Only valid if allowed_attempts > 1). Defaults to null.

parameters.name: quiz[show_correct_answers]
parameters.description:
Only valid if hide_results=null
If false, hides correct answers from students when quiz results are viewed.
Defaults to true.

parameters.name: quiz[show_correct_answers_last_attempt]
parameters.description:
Only valid if show_correct_answers=true and allowed_attempts > 1
If true, hides correct answers from students when quiz results are viewed
until they submit the last attempt for the quiz.
Defaults to false.

parameters.name: quiz[show_correct_answers_at]
parameters.description:
Only valid if show_correct_answers=true
If set, the correct answers will be visible by students only after this
date, otherwise the correct answers are visible once the student hands in
their quiz submission.

parameters.name: quiz[hide_correct_answers_at]
parameters.description:
Only valid if show_correct_answers=true
If set, the correct answers will stop being visible once this date has
passed. Otherwise, the correct answers will be visible indefinitely.

parameters.name: quiz[allowed_attempts]
parameters.description:
Number of times a student is allowed to take a quiz.
Set to -1 for unlimited attempts.
Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: quiz[scoring_policy]
parameters.description:
Required and only valid if allowed_attempts > 1.
Scoring policy for a quiz that students can take multiple times.
Defaults to "keep_highest".

parameters.name: quiz[one_question_at_a_time]
parameters.description:
If true, shows quiz to student one question at a time.
Defaults to false.

parameters.name: quiz[cant_go_back]
parameters.description:
Only valid if one_question_at_a_time=true
If true, questions are locked after answering.
Defaults to false.

parameters.name: quiz[access_code]
parameters.description:
Restricts access to the quiz with a password.
For no access code restriction, set to null.
Defaults to null.

parameters.name: quiz[ip_filter]
parameters.description:
Restricts access to the quiz to computers in a specified IP range.
Filters can be a comma-separated list of addresses, or an address followed by a mask

Examples:
  "192.168.217.1"
  "192.168.217.1/24"
  "192.168.217.1/255.255.255.0"

For no IP filter restriction, set to null.
Defaults to null.

parameters.name: quiz[due_at]
parameters.description:
The day/time the quiz is due.
Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2011-10-21T18:48Z.

parameters.name: quiz[lock_at]
parameters.description:
The day/time the quiz is locked for students.
Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2011-10-21T18:48Z.

parameters.name: quiz[unlock_at]
parameters.description:
The day/time the quiz is unlocked for students.
Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2011-10-21T18:48Z.

parameters.name: quiz[published]
parameters.description:
Whether the quiz should have a draft state of published or unpublished.
NOTE: If students have started taking the quiz, or there are any
submissions for the quiz, you may not unpublish a quiz and will recieve
an error.

parameters.name: quiz[one_time_results]
parameters.description:
Whether students should be prevented from viewing their quiz results past
the first time (right after they turn the quiz in.)
Only valid if "hide_results" is not set to "always".
Defaults to false.

parameters.name: quiz[only_visible_to_overrides]
parameters.description:
Whether this quiz is only visible to overrides (Only useful if
'differentiated assignments' account setting is on)
Defaults to false.

apis.description: This API allows you to cancel a previous request you issued for a report to be generated. Or in the case of an already generated report, you'd like to remove it, perhaps to generate it another time with an updated version that provides new features. You must check the report's generation status before attempting to use this interface. See the "workflow_state" property of the QuizReport's Progress object for more information. Only when the progress reports itself in a "queued" state can the generation be aborted. *Responses* - 204 No Content if your request was accepted - 422 Unprocessable Entity if the report is not being generated or can not be aborted at this stage

operations.summary: Abort the generation of a report, or remove a previously generated one
operations.notes: This API allows you to cancel a previous request you issued for a report to be generated. Or in the case of an already generated report, you'd like to remove it, perhaps to generate it another time with an updated version that provides new features. You must check the report's generation status before attempting to use this interface. See the "workflow_state" property of the QuizReport's Progress object for more information. Only when the progress reports itself in a "queued" state can the generation be aborted. *Responses* - 204 No Content if your request was accepted - 422 Unprocessable Entity if the report is not being generated or can not be aborted at this stage

UserDisplay.description: This mini-object is used for secondary user responses, when we just want to provide enough information to display a user.

id.description: The ID of the user.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

avatar_image_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

html_url.description: URL to access user, either nested to a context or directly.

AnonymousUserDisplay.description: This mini-object is returned in place of UserDisplay when returning student data for anonymous assignments, and includes an anonymous ID to identify a user within the scope of a single assignment.

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this user within the scope of a particular assignment.

avatar_image_url.description: A URL to retrieve a generic avatar.

display_name.description: The anonymized display name for the student.

User.description: A Canvas user, e.g. a student, teacher, administrator, observer, etc.

id.description: The ID of the user.

sortable_name.description: The name of the user that is should be used for sorting groups of users, such as in the gradebook.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to manage SIS information.

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

login_id.description: The unique login id for the user.  This is what the user uses to log in to Canvas.

avatar_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

avatar_state.description: Optional: If avatars are enabled and caller is admin, this field can be requested and will contain the current state of the user's avatar.

enrollments.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return a list of the users active enrollments. See the List enrollments API for more details about the format of these records.

email.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users primary email address.

locale.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users locale in RFC 5646 format.

last_login.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return a timestamp representing the last time the user logged in to canvas.

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

Profile.description: Profile details for a Canvas user.

id.description: The ID of the user.

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

k5_user.description: Optional: Whether or not the user is a K5 user. This field is nil if the user settings are not for the user making the request.

type.description: ['gravatar'|'attachment'|'no_pic'] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.

token.description: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

display_name.description: A textual description of the avatar record.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

content-type.description: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment.

filename.description: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment

size.description: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

PageView.description: The record of a user page view access in Canvas

id.description: A UUID representing the page view.  This is also the unique request id

app_name.description: If the request is from an API request, the app that generated the access token

context_type.description: The type of context for the request

asset_type.description: The type of asset in the context for the request, if any

controller.description: The rails controller that handled the request

action.description: The rails action that handled the request

contributed.description: This field is deprecated, and will always be false

interaction_seconds.description: An approximation of how long the user spent on the page, in seconds

user_request.description: A flag indicating whether the request was user-initiated, or automatic (such as an AJAX call)

render_time.description: How long the response took to render, in seconds

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the browser or program that made the request
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/536.30.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/6.0.5 Safari/536.30.1

participated.description: True if the request counted as participating, such as submitting homework

http_method.description: The HTTP method such as GET or POST

remote_ip.description: The origin IP address of the request

links.description: The page view links to define the relationships

PageViewLinks.description: The links of a page view access in Canvas

user.description: The ID of the user for this page view

context.description: The ID of the context for the request (course id if context_type is Course, etc)

asset.description: The ID of the asset for the request, if any

real_user.description: The ID of the actual user who made this request, if the request was made by a user who was masquerading

account.description: The ID of the account context for this page view

name.description: the actual name of the course
name.example: S1048576 DPMS1200 Intro to Newtonian Mechanics

nickname.description: the calling user's nickname for the course

PairingCode.description: A code used for linking a user to a student to observe them.

code.description: The actual code to be sent to other APIs

workflow_state.description: The current status of the code

visibility.description: possible values are: public, members, admins, and none

author.description: Abbreviated user object UserDisplay (see users API).

assignment.description: The submission's assignment (see the assignments API) (optional)

course.description: The submission's course (see the course API) (optional)

attempt.description: This is the submission attempt number.

body.description: The content of the submission, if it was submitted directly in a text field.

grade.description: The grade for the submission, translated into the assignment grading scheme (so a letter grade, for example).

grade_matches_current_submission.description: A boolean flag which is false if the student has re-submitted since the submission was last graded.

html_url.description: URL to the submission. This will require the user to log in.

preview_url.description: URL to the submission preview. This will require the user to log in.

submitted_at.description: The timestamp when the assignment was submitted

url.description: The URL of the submission (for 'online_url' submissions).

user_id.description: The id of the user who created the submission

grader_id.description: The id of the user who graded the submission. This will be null for submissions that haven't been graded yet. It will be a positive number if a real user has graded the submission and a negative number if the submission was graded by a process (e.g. Quiz autograder and autograding LTI tools).  Specifically autograded quizzes set grader_id to the negative of the quiz id.  Submissions autograded by LTI tools set grader_id to the negative of the tool id.

late.description: Whether the submission was made after the applicable due date

assignment_visible.description: Whether the assignment is visible to the user who submitted the assignment. Submissions where `assignment_visible` is false no longer count towards the student's grade and the assignment can no longer be accessed by the student. `assignment_visible` becomes false for submissions that do not have a grade and whose assignment is no longer assigned to the student's section.

excused.description: Whether the assignment is excused.  Excused assignments have no impact on a user's grade.

late_policy_status.description: The status of the submission in relation to the late policy. Can be late, missing, extended, none, or null.

points_deducted.description: The amount of points automatically deducted from the score by the missing/late policy for a late or missing assignment.

seconds_late.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that an submission is late by.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the submission

extra_attempts.description: Extra submission attempts allowed for the given user and assignment.

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this submission without reference to the owning user. Only included if the caller has administrator access for the current account.

posted_at.description: The date this submission was posted to the student, or nil if it has not been posted.

read_status.description: The read status of this submission for the given user (optional). Including read_status will mark submission(s) as read.

redo_request.description: This indicates whether the submission has been reassigned by the instructor.

course_id.description: The unique identifier for the course.

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

points_possible.description: The maximum points possible for the assignment

submission_types.description: the types of submissions allowed for this assignment list containing one or more of the following: 'discussion_topic', 'online_quiz', 'on_paper', 'none', 'external_tool', 'online_text_entry', 'online_url', 'online_upload', 'media_recording', 'student_annotation'

integration_id.description: Third Party integration id for assignment

integration_data.description: (optional, Third Party integration data for assignment)

include_in_final_grade.description: If false, the assignment will be omitted from the student's final grade

sections.description: Includes attributes of a section for convenience. For more details see Sections API.

integration_id.description: Optional: The integration ID of the section.

origin_course.description: The course to which the section belongs or the course from which the section was cross-listed

xlist_course.description: Optional: Attributes of the xlist course. Only present when the section has been cross-listed. See Courses API for more details

override.description: Optional: Attributes of the assignment override that apply to the section. See Assignment API for more details

CourseAttributes.description: Attributes of a course object.  See Courses API for more details

id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the origin course

name.description: The name of the origin course.

sis_id.description: The sis id of the origin_course.

integration_id.description: The integration ID of the origin_course.

SectionAssignmentOverrideAttributes.description: Attributes of an assignment override that apply to the section object.  See Assignments API for more details

override_title.description: The title for the assignment override

due_at.description: the due date for the assignment. returns null if not present. NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the due date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

UserAssignmentOverrideAttributes.description: Attributes of assignment overrides that apply to users.  See Assignments API for more details

id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the assignment override

title.description: The title of the assignment override.

due_at.description: The time at which this assignment is due

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

students.description: Includes attributes of a student for convenience. For more details see Users API.

StudentAttributes.description: Attributes of student.  See Users API for more details

user_id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the user

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

supplied_batches.description: Which files were included in the SIS import

counts.description: The number of rows processed for each type of import

created.description: This is the number of items that were created.

concluded.description: This is the number of items that marked as completed. This only applies to courses and enrollments.

deactivated.description: This is the number of Enrollments that were marked as 'inactive'. This only applies to enrollments.

restored.description: This is the number of items that were set to an active state from a completed, inactive, or deleted state.

deleted.description: This is the number of items that were deleted.

total_state_changes.description: This is the total number of items that were changed in the sis import. There are a few caveats that can cause this number to not add up to the individual counts. There are some state changes that happen that have no impact to the object. An example would be changing a course from 'created' to 'claimed'. Both of these would be considered an active course, but would increment this counter. In this example the course would not increment the created or restored counters for course statistic.

Account.description: This contains that statistics for accounts.

EnrollmentTerm.description: This contains that statistics for terms.

CommunicationChannel.description: This contains that statistics for communication channels. This is an indirect effect from creating or deleting a user.

AbstractCourse.description: This contains that statistics for abstract courses.

Course.description: This contains that statistics for courses.

CourseSection.description: This contains that statistics for course sections.

Enrollment.description: This contains that statistics for enrollments.

GroupCategory.description: This contains that statistics for group categories.

Group.description: This contains that statistics for groups.

GroupMembership.description: This contains that statistics for group memberships. This can be a direct impact from the import or indirect from an enrollment being deleted.

Pseudonym.description: This contains that statistics for pseudonyms. Pseudonyms are logins for users, and are the object that ties an enrollment to a user. This would be impacted from the user importer.

UserObserver.description: This contains that statistics for user observers.

AccountUser.description: This contains that statistics for account users.

batch_courses_deleted.description: the number of courses that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if courses were deleted

batch_sections_deleted.description: the number of sections that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if sections were deleted

batch_enrollments_deleted.description: the number of enrollments that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if enrollments were deleted

id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import.

created_at.description: The date the SIS import was created.

ended_at.description: The date the SIS import finished. Returns null if not finished.

updated_at.description: The date the SIS import was last updated.

workflow_state.description:
The current state of the SIS import.
 - 'initializing': The SIS import is being created, if this gets stuck in initializing, it will not import and will continue on to next import.
 - 'created': The SIS import has been created.
 - 'importing': The SIS import is currently processing.
 - 'cleanup_batch': The SIS import is currently cleaning up courses, sections, and enrollments not included in the batch for batch_mode imports.
 - 'imported': The SIS import has completed successfully.
 - 'imported_with_messages': The SIS import completed with errors or warnings.
 - 'aborted': The SIS import was aborted.
 - 'failed_with_messages': The SIS import failed with errors.
 - 'failed': The SIS import failed.
 - 'restoring': The SIS import is restoring states of imported items.
 - 'partially_restored': The SIS import is restored some of the states of imported items. This is generally due to passing a param like undelete only.
 - 'restored': The SIS import is restored all of the states of imported items.

progress.description: The progress of the SIS import. The progress will reset when using batch_mode and have a different progress for the cleanup stage

errors_attachment.description: The errors_attachment api object of the SIS import. Only available if there are errors or warning and import has completed.

user.description: The user that initiated the sis_batch. See the Users API for details.

processing_warnings.description: Only imports that are complete will get this data. An array of CSV_file/warning_message pairs.
example: user John Doe has already claimed john_doe's requested login information, skipping
Error while importing CSV. Please contact support.

batch_mode.description: Whether the import was run in batch mode.

batch_mode_term_id.description: The term the batch was limited to.

multi_term_batch_mode.description: Enables batch mode against all terms in term file. Requires change_threshold to be set.

skip_deletes.description: When set the import will skip any deletes.

add_sis_stickiness.description: Whether stickiness was added to the batch changes.

diffing_threshold_exceeded.description: Whether a diffing job failed because the threshold limit got exceeded.

diffing_data_set_identifier.description: The identifier of the data set that this SIS batch diffs against

diffing_remaster.description: Whether diffing remaster data was enabled.

diffed_against_import_id.description: The ID of the SIS Import that this import was diffed against

csv_attachments.description: An array of CSV files for processing

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import.

file.description: The file where the error message occurred.

message.description: The error message that from the record.
message.example: No short_name given for course C001

row_info.description: The contents of the line that had the error.

row.description: The line number where the error occurred. Some Importers do not yet support this. This is a 1 based index starting with the header row.

id.description: The shared_brand_config identifier.

account_id.description: The id of the account it should be shared within.

brand_config_md5.description: The md5 (since BrandConfigs are identified by MD5 and not numeric id) of the BrandConfig to share.

name.description: The name to share this theme as

id.description: The unique identifier for the section.

sis_section_id.description: The sis id of the section. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

integration_id.description: Optional: The integration ID of the section. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import if created through SIS. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

course_id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the course in which the section belongs

sis_course_id.description: The unique SIS identifier for the course in which the section belongs. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

start_at.description: the start date for the section, if applicable

end_at.description: the end date for the section, if applicable

restrict_enrollments_to_section_dates.description: Restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the section

nonxlist_course_id.description: The unique identifier of the original course of a cross-listed section

total_students.description: optional: the total number of active and invited students in the section

userId.description: The lti_user_id or the Canvas user_id

scoreGiven.description: The Current score received in the tool for this line item and user, scaled to the scoreMaximum

scoreMaximum.description: Maximum possible score for this result; it must be present if scoreGiven is present.

comment.description: Comment visible to the student about this score.

timestamp.description: Date and time when the score was modified in the tool. Should use subsecond precision.

activityProgress.description: Indicate to Canvas the status of the user towards the activity's completion. Must be one of Initialized, Started, InProgress, Submitted, Completed

gradingProgress.description: Indicate to Canvas the status of the grading process. A value of PendingManual will require intervention by a grader. Values of NotReady, Failed, and Pending will cause the scoreGiven to be ignored. FullyGraded values will require no action. Possible values are NotReady, Failed, Pending, PendingManual, FullyGraded

id.description: the ID of the rubric

free_form_criterion_comments.description: whether or not free-form comments are used

data.description: An array with all of this Rubric's grading Criteria

assessments.description: If an assessment type is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of rubric assessment objects for a given rubric, based on the assessment type requested. If the user does not request an assessment type this key will be absent.

associations.description: If an association type is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of rubric association objects for a given rubric, based on the association type requested. If the user does not request an association type this key will be absent.

id.description: the ID of the criterion

ratings.description: the possible ratings for this Criterion

id.description: the ID of the rubric

rubric_id.description: the rubric the assessment belongs to

artifact_id.description: the id of the object of the assessment

artifact_attempt.description: the current number of attempts made on the object of the assessment

assessment_type.description: the type of assessment. values will be either 'grading', 'peer_review', or 'provisional_grade'

assessor_id.description: user id of the person who made the assessment

data.description: (Optional) If 'full' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will have their full details contained in their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

comments.description: (Optional) If 'comments_only' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will include only the comments portion of their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

id.description: the ID of the association

association_id.description: the ID of the object this association links to

association_type.description: the type of object this association links to

use_for_grading.description: Whether or not the associated rubric is used for grade calculation

purpose.description: Whether or not the association is for grading (and thus linked to an assignment) or if it's to indicate the rubric should appear in its context. Values will be grading or bookmark.

hide_score_total.description: Whether or not the score total is displayed within the rubric. This option is only available if the rubric is not used for grading.

enabled.description: Whether the role has the permission

locked.description: Whether the permission is locked by this role

applies_to_self.description: Whether the permission applies to the account this role is in. Only present if enabled is true

applies_to_descendants.description: Whether the permission cascades down to sub accounts of the account this role is in. Only present if enabled is true

readonly.description: Whether the permission can be modified in this role (i.e. whether the permission is locked by an upstream role).

explicit.description: Whether the value of enabled is specified explicitly by this role, or inherited from an upstream role.

prior_default.description: The value that would have been inherited from upstream if the role had not explicitly set a value. Only present if explicit is true.

role.description: The label of the role. (Deprecated alias for 'label')

base_role_type.description: The role type that is being used as a base for this role. For account-level roles, this is 'AccountMembership'. For course-level roles, it is an enrollment type.

account.description: JSON representation of the account the role is in.

workflow_state.description: The state of the role: 'active', 'inactive', or 'built_in'

permissions.description: A dictionary of permissions keyed by name (see permissions input parameter in the 'Create a role' API).

id.description: The fully qualified URL for showing the Result

userId.description: The lti_user_id or the Canvas user_id

resultScore.description: The score of the result as defined by Canvas, scaled to the resultMaximum

resultMaximum.description: Maximum possible score for this result; 1 is the default value and will be assumed if not specified otherwise. Minimum value of 0 required.

comment.description: Comment visible to the student about the result.

scoreOf.description: URL of the line item this belongs to

id.description: the ID of the quiz

html_url.description: the HTTP/HTTPS URL to the quiz

mobile_url.description: a url suitable for loading the quiz in a mobile webview.  it will persiste the headless session and, for quizzes in public courses, will force the user to login

preview_url.description: A url that can be visited in the browser with a POST request to preview a quiz as the teacher. Only present when the user may grade

description.example: This is a quiz on Act 3 of Hamlet

assignment_group_id.description: the ID of the quiz's assignment group:

hide_results.description: let students see their quiz responses? possible values: null, 'always', 'until_after_last_attempt'

show_correct_answers.description: show which answers were correct when results are shown? only valid if hide_results=null

show_correct_answers_last_attempt.description: restrict the show_correct_answers option above to apply only to the last submitted attempt of a quiz that allows multiple attempts. only valid if show_correct_answers=true and allowed_attempts > 1

show_correct_answers_at.description: when should the correct answers be visible by students? only valid if show_correct_answers=true

hide_correct_answers_at.description: prevent the students from seeing correct answers after the specified date has passed. only valid if show_correct_answers=true

one_time_results.description: prevent the students from seeing their results more than once (right after they submit the quiz)

scoring_policy.description: which quiz score to keep (only if allowed_attempts != 1) possible values: 'keep_highest', 'keep_latest'

allowed_attempts.description: how many times a student can take the quiz -1 = unlimited attempts

one_question_at_a_time.description: show one question at a time?

question_count.description: the number of questions in the quiz

points_possible.description: The total point value given to the quiz

cant_go_back.description: lock questions after answering? only valid if one_question_at_a_time=true

access_code.description: access code to restrict quiz access

ip_filter.description: IP address or range that quiz access is limited to

published.description: whether the quiz has a published or unpublished draft state.

unpublishable.description: Whether the assignment's 'published' state can be changed to false. Will be false if there are student submissions for the quiz.

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This quiz is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

speedgrader_url.description: Link to Speed Grader for this quiz. Will not be present if quiz is unpublished

quiz_extensions_url.description: Link to endpoint to send extensions for this quiz.

permissions.description: Permissions the user has for the quiz

all_dates.description: list of due dates for the quiz

version_number.description: Current version number of the quiz

question_types.description: List of question types in the quiz

anonymous_submissions.description: Whether survey submissions will be kept anonymous (only applicable to 'graded_survey', 'survey' quiz types)

QuizPermissions.description: Permissions the user has for the quiz

read.description: whether the user can view the quiz

submit.description: whether the user may submit a submission for the quiz

create.description: whether the user may create a new quiz

manage.description: whether the user may edit, update, or delete the quiz

read_statistics.description: whether the user may view quiz statistics for this quiz

review_grades.description: whether the user may review grades for all quiz submissions for this quiz

update.description: whether the user may update the quiz

id.description: The ID of the quiz submission.

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the quiz submission belongs to.

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that made the quiz submission.

submission_id.description: The ID of the Submission the quiz submission represents.

started_at.description: The time at which the student started the quiz submission.

finished_at.description: The time at which the student submitted the quiz submission.

end_at.description: The time at which the quiz submission will be overdue, and be flagged as a late submission.

attempt.description: For quizzes that allow multiple attempts, this field specifies the quiz submission attempt number.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student was allowed to re-take the quiz over the multiple-attempt limit.

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time allowed for the quiz submission, in minutes.

manually_unlocked.description: The student can take the quiz even if it's locked for everyone else

time_spent.description: Amount of time spent, in seconds.

score.description: The score of the quiz submission, if graded.

score_before_regrade.description: The original score of the quiz submission prior to any re-grading.

kept_score.description: For quizzes that allow multiple attempts, this is the score that will be used, which might be the score of the latest, or the highest, quiz submission.

fudge_points.description: Number of points the quiz submission's score was fudged by.

has_seen_results.description: Whether the student has viewed their results to the quiz.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the quiz submission. Possible values: ['untaken'|'pending_review'|'complete'|'settings_only'|'preview'].

overdue_and_needs_submission.description: Indicates whether the quiz submission is overdue and needs submission

id.description: The ID of the QuizQuestion this answer is for.

answer.description: The provided answer (if any) for this question. The format of this parameter depends on the type of the question, see the Appendix for more information.

answers.description: The possible answers for this question when those possible answers are necessary.  The presence of this parameter is dependent on permissions.

QuizSubmissionEvent.description: An event passed from the Quiz Submission take page

created_at.description: a timestamp record of creation time

event_type.description: the type of event being sent

event_data.description: custom contextual data for the specific event type

id.description: The ID of the quiz statistics report.

quiz_id.description:
The ID of the Quiz the statistics report is for. 
NOTE: AVAILABLE ONLY IN NON-JSON-API REQUESTS.

multiple_attempts_exist.description: Whether there are any students that have made mutliple submissions for this quiz.

includes_all_versions.description: In the presence of multiple attempts, this field describes whether the statistics describe all the submission attempts and not only the latest ones.

generated_at.description: The time at which the statistics were generated, which is usually after the occurrence of a quiz event, like a student submitting it.

url.description: The API HTTP/HTTPS URL to this quiz statistics.

html_url.description: The HTTP/HTTPS URL to the page where the statistics can be seen visually.

question_statistics.description: Question-specific statistics for each question and its answers.

submission_statistics.description: Question-specific statistics for each question and its answers.

links.description:
JSON-API construct that contains links to media related to this quiz statistics object. 
NOTE: AVAILABLE ONLY IN JSON-API REQUESTS.

QuizStatisticsLinks.description: Links to media related to QuizStatistics.

quiz.description: HTTP/HTTPS API URL to the quiz this statistics describe.

QuizStatisticsQuestionStatistics.description: Statistics for submissions made to a specific quiz question.

responses.description: Number of students who have provided an answer to this question. Blank or empty responses are not counted.

answers.description: Statistics related to each individual pre-defined answer.

QuizStatisticsAnswerStatistics.description: Statistics for a specific pre-defined answer in a Multiple-Choice or True/False quiz question.

id.description: ID of the answer.

text.description: The text attached to the answer.

weight.description: An integer to determine correctness of the answer. Incorrect answers should be 0, correct answers should 100

responses.description: Number of students who have chosen this answer.

QuizStatisticsAnswerPointBiserial.description: A point-biserial construct for a single pre-defined answer in a Multiple-Choice or True/False question.

answer_id.description: ID of the answer the point biserial is for.

point_biserial.description: The point biserial value for this answer. Value ranges between -1 and 1.

correct.description: Convenience attribute that denotes whether this is the correct answer as opposed to being a distractor. This is mutually exclusive with the `distractor` value

distractor.description: Convenience attribute that denotes whether this is a distractor answer and not the correct one. This is mutually exclusive with the `correct` value

QuizStatisticsSubmissionStatistics.description: Generic statistics for all submissions for a quiz.

unique_count.description: The number of students who have taken the quiz.

score_average.description: The mean of the student submission scores.

score_stdev.description: Standard deviation of the submission scores.

scores.description: A percentile distribution of the student scores, each key is the percentile (ranges between 0 and 100%) while the value is the number of students who received that score.

correct_count_average.description: The mean of the number of questions answered correctly by each student.

incorrect_count_average.description: The mean of the number of questions answered incorrectly by each student.

duration_average.description: The average time spent by students while taking the quiz.

id.description: the ID of the quiz report

report_type.description: which type of report this is possible values: 'student_analysis', 'item_analysis'

readable_type.description: a human-readable (and localized) version of the report_type

includes_all_versions.description: boolean indicating whether the report represents all submissions or only the most recent ones for each student

anonymous.description: boolean indicating whether the report is for an anonymous survey. if true, no student names will be included in the csv

generatable.description: boolean indicating whether the report can be generated, which is true unless the quiz is a survey one

updated_at.description: when the report was last updated

url.description: the API endpoint for this report

file.description: if the report has finished generating, a File object that represents it. refer to the Files API for more information about the format

progress_url.description: if the report has not yet finished generating, a URL where information about its progress can be retrieved. refer to the Progress API for more information (Note: not available in JSON-API format)

progress.description: if the report is being generated, a Progress object that represents the operation. Refer to the Progress API for more information about the format. (Note: available only in JSON-API format)

id.description: The ID of the quiz question.

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the question belongs to.

position.description: The order in which the question will be retrieved and displayed.

question_text.example: Which of the following is NOT a prime number?

points_possible.description: The maximum amount of points possible received for getting this question correct.

correct_comments.description: The comments to display if the student answers the question correctly.

incorrect_comments.description: The comments to display if the student answers incorrectly.
incorrect_comments.example: Unfortunately, that IS a prime number.

neutral_comments.description: The comments to display regardless of how the student answered.
neutral_comments.example: Goldbach's conjecture proposes that every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.

answers.description: An array of available answers to display to the student.

id.description: The unique identifier for the answer.  Do not supply if this answer is part of a new question

answer_weight.description: An integer to determine correctness of the answer. Incorrect answers should be 0, correct answers should be 100.

answer_comments.description: Specific contextual comments for a particular answer.
answer_comments.example: Remember to check your spelling prior to submitting this answer.

text_after_answers.description: Used in missing word questions.  The text to follow the missing word

answer_match_left.description: Used in matching questions.  The static value of the answer that will be displayed on the left for students to match for.

answer_match_right.description: Used in matching questions. The correct match for the value given in answer_match_left.  Will be displayed in a dropdown with the other answer_match_right values..

matching_answer_incorrect_matches.description:
Used in matching questions. A list of distractors, delimited by new lines (
) that will be seeded with all the answer_match_right values.

numerical_answer_type.description: Used in numerical questions.  Values can be 'exact_answer', 'range_answer', or 'precision_answer'.

exact.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

margin.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'. The margin of error allowed for the student's answer.

approximate.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

precision.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'. The numerical precision that will be used when comparing the student's answer.

start.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The start of the allowed range (inclusive).

end.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The end of the allowed range (inclusive).

blank_id.description: Used in fill in multiple blank and multiple dropdowns questions.

id.description: The ID of the question group.

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the question group belongs to.

name.description: The name of the question group.

pick_count.description: The number of questions to pick from the group to display to the student.

question_points.description: The amount of points allotted to each question in the group.

assessment_question_bank_id.description: The ID of the Assessment question bank to pull questions from.

position.description: The order in which the question group will be retrieved and displayed.

name.description: A unique name for the filter.

account.description: Name of the Account (or Quiz) the IP filter is defined in.

filter.description: An IP address (or range mask) this filter embodies.

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the quiz extension belongs to.

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that needs the quiz extension.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student is allowed to re-take the quiz over the multiple-attempt limit.

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time allowed for the quiz submission, in minutes.

manually_unlocked.description: The student can take the quiz even if it's locked for everyone else

end_at.description: The time at which the quiz submission will be overdue, and be flagged as a late submission.

QuizAssignmentOverrideSet.description: Set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

quiz_id.description: ID of the quiz those dates are for.

due_dates.description: An array of quiz assignment overrides. For students, this array will always contain a single item which is the set of dates that apply to that student. For teachers and staff, it may contain more.

all_dates.description: An array of all assignment overrides active for the quiz. This is visible only to teachers and staff.

QuizAssignmentOverrideSetContainer.description: Container for set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

QuizAssignmentOverride.description: Set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

id.description: ID of the assignment override, unless this is the base construct, in which case the 'id' field is omitted.

due_at.description: The date after which any quiz submission is considered late.

unlock_at.description: Date when the quiz becomes available for taking.

lock_at.description: When the quiz will stop being available for taking. A value of null means it can always be taken.

title.description: Title of the section this assignment override is for, if any.

base.description: If this property is present, it means that dates in this structure are not based on an assignment override, but are instead for all students.
